children.subject: Please don't lol. I took 70 over the summer and that's all I did. I knew someone that took 70 and 61a and they never slept and I think got very low grades.

history.content:
CS 70 requires 15-20 hours of work a week aside for lectures and discussions (and I had some background in most of its topics) in a regular semester. Though I haven't taken it in the summer - a can assume it's probably twice the time consumption since summer is half of a regular semester.

That alone should be enough for me to strongly advice against taking it with any other class, let alone a technical one, and especially 61A (which is fairly challenging).

Not even sure it's even possible to get good grades in both classes during the summer.

children.subject: I'm tutoring for 61C and taking 70 over the summer. I'd be down to work together!

Here's my email felicia.trinh at berkeley 

You're a life saver!
OP here. If anyone else is taking them together this summer, I’d love to work together.

This is for anyone in the future in the same position. Taking 61C and 70 together this last summer was doable but very difficult. I wouldn’t want to repeat the experience. I did manage to achieve an A- in 61C and a B+ in 70 thanks to the wonderful course staff, an awesome lab partner, and amazing group mates. If you are driven and good at managing your time, I think you would be able to do just as well or even better.

history.content:
Has anyone taken both CS 61C and 70 over the summer? If so, how was the workload or time commitment? Was it difficult to get at least a B+ in CS 70? 

I know it’s not recommended to take them together, but I’m switching to CS from chemical engineering so I’m, unfortunately, used to 4 techs a semester.
history.subject: CS 70 and CS 61C Over the Summer
